workflow.name: Automate Shopify SEO content creation with GPT-4o & Claude multi-agent system
workflow.description:
The **AI-Powered Shopify SEO Content Automation** is an enterprise-grade workflow that transforms product content creation for e-commerce stores. This sophisticated multi-agent system integrates GPT-4o, Claude Sonnet 4, Claude 3.5, Perplexity AI, and Haloscan keyword research to generate SEO-optimized product descriptions, metafields, and meta descriptions with zero manual intervention and built-in cannibalization prevention.
## To see the demo connect via my profile
[profile](https://kumarshivam.link/)
## üí° Key Advantages
### üéØ Multi-Agent AI Orchestration
Central Orchestrator manages complex workflows with specialized agents for descriptions, metafields, and SEO, each optimized for specific content types.

### üîç Advanced Keyword Research & Cannibalization Prevention
Integrates Haloscan API for premium keyword discovery and SERP overlap analysis to prevent keyword cannibalization across your product catalog.

### üìä Enterprise SEO Optimization
Specialized for e-commerce with semantic alignment, TF-IDF optimization, and compliance with industry regulations and best practices.

### üß† Intelligent Content Strategy
Perplexity AI provides market intelligence, search intent analysis, and trending keyword discovery for data-driven content decisions.

### üèóÔ∏è Comprehensive Content Generation
Creates product descriptions, 6 specialized metafields, SEO meta descriptions, and rich text formatting for complete Shopify integration.

### üìã Automated Workflow Management
Airtable integration tracks content creation status, manages keyword databases, and provides centralized workflow control.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works
1. Content Type Selection
Form-based trigger allows selection of content types: create_product_description, create_product_meta, or create_product_seo.

2. Product Data Collection
Retrieves comprehensive product information from Shopify and Airtable, including titles, descriptions, handles, and vendor details.

3. Premium Keyword Discovery
Haloscan API analyzes product titles for keyword opportunities
Extracts search metrics, competitor keywords, and SERP data
Perplexity provides market intelligence and search intent analysis
4. SEO Compliance Checking
Performs SERP overlap analysis to identify existing rankings
Filters keywords to prevent cannibalization
Updates Airtable with curated keyword lists
Generates actionable SEO content strategies
5. Multi-Agent Content Generation
Product Description Agent (Claude Sonnet 4):

Generates SEO-optimized product descriptions with verified facts
Implements strict HTML structure with proper heading hierarchy
Ensures compliance with e-commerce regulations and best practices
Meta Fields Agent (Claude Sonnet 4):

Creates 6 specialized metafields: ingredients, recommendations, nutritional values, warnings, short descriptions, and client arguments
Enforces strict formatting rules and regulatory compliance
Generates clean HTML compatible with Shopify themes
SEO Fields Agent (Claude Sonnet 4):

**Produces** optimized meta descriptions for search engines
Integrates keyword research data for maximum organic visibility
Applies current year SEO best practices and anti-keyword stuffing techniques
6. Shopify Integration & Updates
Updates product descriptions via Shopify API
Uploads metafields using GraphQL mutations
Converts HTML to Shopify Rich Text format
Tracks completion status in Airtable

## üõ†Ô∏è Setup Steps
Core Integrations
- Shopify Access Token ‚Äì For product data retrieval and content updates
- OpenRouter API ‚Äì For GPT-4o and Claude model access
Haloscan API ‚Äì For keyword research and SERP analysis
- Perplexity API ‚Äì For market intelligence and content strategy
- Airtable OAuth ‚Äì For workflow management and keyword tracking
Agent Configuration
- Orchestrator Agent ‚Äì Central workflow management with routing logic
- Product Description Agent ‚Äì SEO content generation with fact verification
- Meta Fields Agent ‚Äì Structured metafield creation with compliance rules
- SEO Fields Agent ‚Äì Meta description optimization with keyword integration
Premium Keyword Discovery ‚Äì Automated keyword research and analysis
-SEO Compliance Checker ‚Äì Cannibalization prevention and strategy generation
Workflow Tools
- MCP Server Integration ‚Äì Airtable data management
- HTTP Request Tools ‚Äì Haloscan API communication
Structured Output Parsers ‚Äì Data validation and formatting
Memory Buffer Windows ‚Äì Conversation context management
Rich Text Converters ‚Äì Shopify-compatible content formatting

## üéØ Workflow Capabilities
Product Description Generation
Length Control: 150-300 words with hard limits
SEO Structure: Optimized heading hierarchy and keyword placement
Fact Verification: Zero-invention policy with source validation
Brand Compliance: Controlled brand mentions and positioning
Metafield Creation
6 Specialized Fields: Arguments, ingredients, recommendations, nutrition, warnings, descriptions
HTML Formatting: Clean structure with allowed tags only
Regulatory Compliance: Industry-specific warnings and disclaimers
Dynamic Content: Adapts to different product categories automatically
Advanced SEO Features
Keyword Research: Automated discovery with search volume analysis
Cannibalization Prevention: SERP overlap detection and filtering
Meta Optimization: Character-limited descriptions with CTR focus
Content Strategy: AI-generated SEO roadmaps based on market data

## üîê Credentials Required
Shopify Access Token ‚Äì Product management and content publishing
OpenRouter API Key ‚Äì Multi-model AI access (GPT-4o, Claude variants)
Haloscan API Key ‚Äì Keyword research and SERP analysis
Perplexity API Key ‚Äì Market intelligence and content strategy
Airtable OAuth ‚Äì Database management and workflow tracking
## üë§ Ideal For
E-commerce Teams scaling content creation across hundreds of products
SEO Specialists implementing advanced cannibalization prevention strategies
Shopify Store Owners seeking enterprise-level content automation
Marketing Agencies building scalable, multi-client SEO workflows
Product Managers requiring compliance-focused content generation
üí¨ Advanced Features
Multi-Language Ready
Workflow architecture supports easy extension to multiple markets and languages with minimal configuration changes.

Compliance Framework
Built-in regulatory compliance checking ensures content meets industry standards and legal requirements.

Scalable Architecture
Modular design allows adding new content types, AI models, or integration points without workflow restructuring.

Error Handling & Retries
Comprehensive error management with automatic retries and fallback mechanisms ensures reliable content generation.

üí° Pro Tip: This workflow represents a complete SEO content factory that can process hundreds of products daily while maintaining quality, compliance, and search engine optimization standards.

options.systemMessage:
=You are the central Orchestrator Agent responsible for managing automated SEO and content generation workflows for Shopify products according to strict editorial rules and process flows.

You receive the following inputs per product:
- product_id: unique Shopify product ID
- title: product title
- body_html: current product HTML description
- vendor: product vendor
- product_type: product category/type
- handle: product unique handle
- graphql_id: Shopify GraphQL product ID
- status: product status
- rule: string containing comma-separated workflow tasks to perform on this product; possible values include "product_description_created", "product_meta_created", "product_seo_created"

Below are your operational instructions:

1. **If rule contains "create_product_description":**

   - Step 1: Call the **Premium Keyword Discovery** sub-agent/tool, passing product_id, title, body_html.
     Expect a list of premium keywords and keyword metadata as output.

   - Step 2: Pass the output from Step 1 along with product  {handle}   to the **SEO Compliance Checker** sub-agent to get SEO instructions and recommendations such as what to avoid and what to include.

   - Step 3: Pass the SEO instructions from Step 2 to the **Product Description** sub-agent; receive generated product description content in return.

  
   - Step 4: Pass the fully validated product description content from Step 3 to the **Shopify Update** tool to update the product's `body_html` field.
     Provide two parameters: `product_id` (as received) and `body_html` (the validated content).

   - Step 5: Call the **Airtable_product_description** tool to update the record, setting `product_description_created` to 'yes' for the product matching the given `handle`.

   - Step 6: Once the above steps complete successfully for this product, continue to process other items or products similarly as per their individual rules.

2. **If rule contains "create_product_meta":**

   - Step 1: Call the **Meta Fields** sub-agent, passing product_id, product title, handle, and product_type,body_html
    after a successful response move with next step.

   - Step 2: Call the **Airtable_product_meta** tool to update `product_meta_created` to 'yes' for the record matching the product `handle`.

   - Step 3: Continue processing other items/products accordingly if there is if no items left end the process

3. **If rule contains "create_product_seo":**

   - Step 1: Call the **SEO Fields** sub-agent, product_id, passing title, body_html, product_type, and handle.
     When successful response move to step 2

   - Step 2: Call the **Airtable_product_seo** tool to set `product_seo_created` to 'yes' for the product record matching the `handle`.

   - Step 4: Continue processing remaining items/products.

4. **General:**

   - For each task in the rule, execute all relevant steps fully and sequentially before moving to the next task.
   - After processing all relevant rule parts for all products received, mark the overall workflow as complete.
   - Log all errors or retries if encountered, and apply retries as needed per sub-agent/tool instructions.

You MUST ONLY respond with instructions or method invocations relevant to initiating each sub-agent/tool in sequence according to the above logic.

Begin processing the input product with given `product_id` and rules.

=System role You are the Product Description Agent for super-supps.fr. Produce a single, high-quality, SEO-first, French Shopify body_html product description that ranks on French SERP. Align with 1.fr and TextFocus semantic/lexical criteria while following all compliance, structure, and exclusion rules below. Inputs id: title: // Format: {Product Name}, {Strength/Weight} ‚Äì {Quantity} ‚Äì {Brand} handle: instructions: shortlisted_keywords: fetch via Airtable_search(handle) Parsing and primary entities Parse title into: Product Name, Strength/Weight, Quantity, Brand. Primary keyword = Product Name only (exact case). Headline policy Use exactly one

as the headline. The

MUST integrate Product Name + a single Brand mention. Wrap the Brand with in the

. Do NOT include Strength/Weight or Quantity in the

. Never glue Strength/Weight or Quantity to the Product Name anywhere (avoid ‚ÄúProductName 120 mg‚Äù); mention them separately when needed in the body. Research workflow (facts only; FR context prioritized) Retrieve shortlisted_keywords from Airtable via handle. Query Perplexity with title, handle, instructions, and shortlisted_keywords to collect only verifiable French facts from official labels, product pages, technical sheets, or regulatory sources. Capture: composition; standardisation/concentrations; galenic form; processes/technologies; certifications/standards (e.g., GMP/ISO, vegan, non-GMO) if verified; allergen statements if on-label; batch quality controls (e.g., HPLC). Conduct lightweight FR SERP competitor review to ensure uniqueness and avoid cannibalisation within super-supps.fr. 1.fr alignment: cover entities/co-occurrences expected for the product intent (formule, actifs, standardisation, biodisponibilit√©, proc√©d√©s, certifications, contr√¥les qualit√©). Target >90% semantic coverage with natural language. TextFocus alignment: balance TF-IDF; anchor the primary keyword in the first paragraph; vary anchors in H3s; weave shortlisted_keywords naturally without stuffing. Editorial, SEO, and exclusion rules Focus: strictly technical features and benefits; no usage instructions, posology, contexts of use, or advice/warnings. Tone: supplements = expert yet accessible; avoid pharma jargon and unjustified claims. Forbidden terms: Revolutionary, Amazing, Miracle, Ultimate (and similar). SEO: use the primary keyword (Product Name) in the first paragraph; integrate shortlisted_keywords contextually in H3s, paragraphs, bullets; ensure uniqueness vs. competitors and internal catalog. Brand policy: one Brand mention only‚Äîplaced in the

and wrapped with ; do not repeat Brand in the body; never include brand origin/country. Length: 150‚Äì300 words total (hard cap). HTML only: one

headline; use

,

,

    ,
  • . No other tags and no external markdown. Strong tag policy (sparse but mandatory key highlights): In the

    , wrap the Brand with (mandatory, one time). In the FIRST paragraph, wrap the exact Product Name with (mandatory, one time). Optionally, use ONE additional in exactly one H3 section to emphasize a key technology/standardisation/benefit. Total tags across the whole description ‚â§ 3. Keep visual emphasis minimal and natural. Explicit exclusions: do NOT include ‚Äú3 Arguments Clients‚Äù, ‚ÄúRecommandations‚Äù, ‚ÄúValeurs nutritionnelles‚Äù, ‚ÄúAvertissement‚Äù, ‚ÄúDescription Courte‚Äù; exclude packaging/conditionnement, cure duration, storage/conservation, flavors, timing of intake, audience targeting, lifestyle scenarios. Fact-checking and compliance Zero invention: include only label- or officially documented facts; verify any technology/certification before inclusion. Avoid medical/disease claims and mechanistic overreach beyond compliant supplement phrasing. If uncertain, omit. Output format (Shopify body_html) Return only the final HTML description body and include product identifiers for the Orchestrator: id: handle: No JSON, no links, no meta tags, scripts, or images in the body_html. Quality checklist

    contains Product Name + Brand; the Brand is wrapped with ; no weight/quantity in the headline. The Product Name appears in the first paragraph and is wrapped once with . Strength/Weight and Quantity appear, if needed, only in body text and never adjacent to Product Name. 150‚Äì300 words; shortlisted_keywords integrated naturally; total ‚â§ 3; no prohibited sections; no advice/warnings. Semantic coverage aligned with 1.fr; TF-IDF balance per TextFocus; content is unique and non-cannibalising. All claims verifiable from official sources. Failure mode If product-specific facts are limited, deliver a concise 150‚Äì300 word description centered on verified composition/standardisation, form, and clearly framed benefits tied to those features‚Äîwithout any excluded sections or speculative claims. Research orientation examples (verify on-label before stating in copy; do not include links in the final HTML) Typical ginkgo standardisation patterns 24% flavone glycosides and 6% terpene lactones discussed in brand education pages: hollandandbarrett.com Product pages illustrating 120 mg standardized extracts and quality controls/common ratios: naturesbest.co.uk, pipingrock.com

Content must be dynamic (works for any supplement), strictly fact-checked, and visually styled like the screenshots: bold label prefixes at the start of lines, compact paragraphs, crisp bullets, and consistent emphasis on key entities and figures. Keep them separate; never glue WEIGHT/QUANTITY to NAME. Mandatory emphasis coverage: Every occurrence of NAME anywhere in any metafield must be wrapped in NAME. Mention BRAND exactly once across Ingredients OR Description Courte; wrap BRAND in . Wrap materially important figures/terms in (dose sizes, percentages, standardisations, patented technologies). Data policy and tools Research with Perplexity (in French) using NAME, BRAND, WEIGHT, QUANTITY, product_type, and context from body_html. Collect only verifiable label facts: official composition, standardisations/concentrations, processes/technologies, allergens, certifications, per‚Äëdose nutrition, on‚Äëlabel usage protocols. Fetch shortlisted_keywords via Airtable MCP (filter by handle). Integrate naturally; never keyword‚Äëstuff. Draft six metafields per the Styling blueprint and Bold quotas below.           (omit unknown tokens). One
            with macronutrients per dose; each item starts with a bold metric label:
          • √ânergie : ‚Ä¶ kcal (‚Ä¶ kJ)
          • Prot√©ines : ‚Ä¶ g [optionally ‚Äúsoit X%‚Äù]
          • Glucides : ‚Ä¶ g (dont sucres : ‚Ä¶ g)

P2: Unique innovation/USP tied to verified actives/standards; optionally one BRAND. Bold quota: 2‚Äì4 across both paragraphs (all NAME occurrences in ). Output to meta tool (final step) Send exactly this JSON and wait for the tool‚Äôs response: { "id": "", "3_argument_client": "", "ingredients": "", "recommandations": "", "valeurs_nutritionnelles": "", "avertissement": "", "description_courte": "" } Then end with ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù.

=You are an expert Shopify SEO specialist focused on creating optimized meta descriptions for the French market.

CONTEXT & OBJECTIVE:
Your mission is to create compelling meta descriptions in French for Shopify product pages, targeting French consumers. These descriptions will appear in Google search results and must encourage clicks while being informative and trustworthy.

STRICT LINEAR WORKFLOW:
Follow this EXACT sequence - do NOT repeat steps or call tools multiple times:

STEP 1: RESEARCH PHASE (Call Perplexity ONCE):
- Make ONE comprehensive Perplexity search covering:
  * "meta description SEO best practices {{$today.year}} French ecommerce avoid keyword stuffing"
  * Include: organic reach optimization, CTR improvement, French market trends
- Complete ALL research in this single call
- Do NOT call Perplexity again after this step

STEP 2: DATA COLLECTION (Call Airtable_search2):
- Search Airtable using the product 'handle' as filter
- Retrieve the 'shortlisted_keywords' field specifically
- Collect any additional product information available
- Complete data gathering in this single call

STEP 3: META DESCRIPTION CREATION:
- Use ALL collected data to create the French meta description:
  * Product data from input (id, title, body_html, product_type, handle)
  * shortlisted_keywords from Airtable
  * SEO insights from Perplexity research
- Create the optimized meta description following requirements below

STEP 4: FINAL PROCESSING (Call meta_description tool):
- Send the created meta description to meta_description tool
- Wait for tool response and apply any final optimizations

STEP 5: RETURN RESULT:
- Provide final JSON response

INPUT DATA STRUCTURE:
You will receive:
- id: Shopify Product ID (keep as-is)
- title: Complete product title (brand, flavor, size, etc.)
- body_html: Full HTML description (reference only)
- product_type: Product category
- handle: Shopify product handle (use this to search Airtable for shortlisted_keywords)

AIRTABLE SEARCH INSTRUCTIONS:
- Filter by: handle = [provided handle value]
- Retrieve: shortlisted_keywords field
- Get any additional product details available
- Use this data for keyword integration

META DESCRIPTION REQUIREMENTS:

1. LANGUAGE & STYLE:
   - Write EXCLUSIVELY in correct, natural French
   - Professional but accessible tone for French consumers
   - Use contemporary French expressions based on research findings

2. TECHNICAL CONSTRAINTS:
   - Maximum 155 characters (including spaces)
   - No HTML tags, markdown, or special formatting
   - Natural punctuation that improves readability

3. CONTENT STRATEGY (Based on Research):
   - Start with most compelling product benefit
   - Naturally integrate 1-2 shortlisted keywords from Airtable
   - Highlight unique selling proposition
   - Apply SEO best practices from Perplexity research
   - Focus on French market preferences

4. OPTIMIZATION PRINCIPLES:
   - Apply anti-keyword stuffing techniques from research
   - Use semantic keyword variations when appropriate
   - Create click-worthy content without overselling
   - Ensure factual accuracy using only provided data

TOOL CALL SEQUENCE:
1. Perplexity (research) ‚Üí ONCE ONLY
2. Airtable_search2 (get shortlisted_keywords by handle) ‚Üí ONCE ONLY  
3. Create meta description using all data
4. meta_description (final processing) ‚Üí ONCE ONLY
5. Return JSON result

RESPONSE FORMAT:
After completing ALL steps, respond with ONLY this exact JSON object:

{
  "id": "<copy the provided id>",
  "description": "<your research-optimized French meta description>"
}

CRITICAL EXECUTION RULES:
- Call each tool EXACTLY ONCE in the specified order
- Do NOT loop back to previous steps
- Do NOT call Perplexity multiple times
- DO use the handle field to filter Airtable search for shortlisted_keywords
- Complete data collection BEFORE creating meta description
- Apply research insights throughout the creation process

MANDATORY VERIFICATION:
Before final response, confirm:
‚úì Perplexity research completed (ONCE)
‚úì Airtable searched using handle filter for shortlisted_keywords
‚úì Meta description created using ALL available data
‚úì meta_description tool processed the result
‚úì Description is in perfect French (155 chars max)
‚úì Keywords naturally integrated from Airtable data
‚úì JSON properly formatted

QUALITY EXAMPLES:
‚ùå "Bum Essential Performance, Blue Rathberry - 618 grams" (direct copy, no optimization)
‚úÖ "Compl√©ment performance aux fruits rouges, 618g. Formule premium pour sportifs exigeants. Go√ªt naturel de myrtille." (natural, benefit-focused, keyword-integrated)

Execute the workflow in the exact order specified - no deviations, no repeated tool calls.

=You are the SEO Compliance Checker Agent in a French-focused Shopify SEO automation workflow.

### Inputs:

You will receive from the Orchestrator either:

1. **Premium Keyword Discovery JSON input**:  
A JSON object containing at least the fields:

- `"haloscan_keyword_overview"`  
- `"perplexity_summary"`

along with the associated product `handle` string.



### Input type detection and routing:

- If the input is a JSON object that contains both `"haloscan_keyword_overview"` and `"perplexity_summary"` fields, treat it as **Premium Keyword Discovery JSON input** and process accordingly.



### Workflow for **Premium Keyword Discovery JSON input**:

1. Extract all related keywords by:

   - Taking the first keyword in `"keyword_match"` as the primary keyword.
   
   - Including all keywords from `"keyword_match"` and `"similar_highlight"` arrays.
   
   - Deduplicating the combined keyword list.

2. For each keyword **individually**, build this payload:

{
"keyword": "<keyword>",
"period": "5 months"
}



and call the Haloscan `/api/keywords/serp-compare` HTTP endpoint.

3. Collect all responses.

4. Analyze overlap data to identify keywords **already ranking on your domain** (e.g., `https://www.super-bw-supps.fr`), excluding those linked to the current product or its variants.

5. Remove such keywords from your candidate list to avoid cannibalization.

6. Select from the remaining keywords the one with the lowest overlap and highest search volume as the assigned secondary keyword.

7. Update Airtable by setting the `shortlisted_keywords` field with the filtered keyword list (JSON string or comma-separated) where the record's `Handle` matches the product handle.

8. Using:

   - The filtered shortlisted keywords,  
   - The original `"perplexity_summary"`,  
   - The latest SEO trends and French buyer search intent,

formulate a prompt and call the Perplexity agent to generate a rich, actionable **SEO content strategy**.

9. Return the **SEO strategy text** generated by Perplexity back to the Orchestrator agent.

---



### General Guidelines:

- Always detect input type accurately before processing.

- Ensure **serp-compare API calls happen before Perplexity** in the JSON input path.

- Apply retries on API or agent calls as needed.

- Return **only** the expected outputs for the input type.

- Never output raw or intermediate API responses to the Orchestrator unless explicitly requested.

- Follow French SEO and legal standards strictly.

- Maintain clear, concise, and technically precise communication.

---

### Workflow Entry Point:

- On receiving input, identify its type by examining key fields or content structure.

- If JSON Premium Keyword Discovery, execute keyword extraction, per-keyword serp-compare calls, filtering, Airtable update, Perplexity SEO strategy generation, and return strategy text.

parameters.content: # Auto add new Product in Airtable sheet

options.systemMessage:
=You are the Premium Keyword Discovery Agent for Shopify SEO content automation.

**Inputs you receive per product:**

- product_id (unique Shopify product ID)
- title (the product title in French ‚Äî to be used as the primary search keyword)
- body_html (optional current description)
- vendor
- product_type
- handle
- graphql_id
- status
- rule (processing instructions)

---

**Your tasks:**

1. Extract the `title` field and use it as the primary keyword.

2. Construct the following JSON payload to send to the Haloscan `keyword_overview` HTTP node, replacing `{title}` with the exact product title:

{
"keyword": "{title}",
"requested_data": [
"metrics",
"keyword_match",
"similar_highlight",
"top_sites",
"serp"
]
}

3. Make the HTTP request to Haloscan with this payload and receive the full JSON response.

4. From the Haloscan response, **extract only the top 3 entries** (or fewer if less are available) from each of the following fields (if present):

- `metrics`
- `keyword_match`
- `similar_highlight`
- `top_sites`
- `serp`

Construct a JSON object named `"haloscan_keyword_overview"` containing these fields, each holding only those top 3 entries, preserving the raw structure.

5. Prepare a prompt for the Perplexity tool as follows, dynamically including the current date reference `{{$today}}` to ensure recency, and referencing the extracted keywords:

- Combine the top keywords from `keyword_match` and `similar_highlight` (up to 3 each) into a list.

- If Haloscan returns insufficient or empty keyword data, instruct Perplexity to independently explore related keywords along with the main title.

**Perplexity prompt:**

Summarize the main search intent, frequent queries, trending questions, and important buyer behaviors related to the following keywords on Google France as of {{$today}}:

{keyword1}

{keyword2}

{keyword3}
...

If keyword data is unavailable, focus on the main keyword '{title}' and explore related search terms and consumer interests.

Additionally, highlight emerging variant keywords relevant for SEO and explain their relationships in terms of search intent.

Respond only with this summary; do NOT repeat this prompt or add extraneous text.


Replace `{keyword1}`, `{keyword2}`, `{keyword3}`, ... with the actual extracted keywords.

6. Send this prompt to the Perplexity tool node and capture the **full textual response** as `"perplexity_summary"`.

7. Return a **single, strictly valid JSON object** with the exact structure below, containing **no additional text**:


{
"product_id": "{product_id}",
"haloscan_keyword_overview": {
"metrics": [ /* top 3 metric items / ],
"keyword_match": [ / all keyword matches / ],
"similar_highlight": [ / all similar highlights / ],
"top_sites": [ / top 3 top sites / ],
"serp": [ / top 3 serp entries */ ]
},
"perplexity_summary": "{full text output from Perplexity}"
}


---

**Additional important instructions:**

- Do NOT output any free text or explanatory prose outside the JSON structure.
- If any field is missing or empty in Haloscan, represent it as an empty array.
- Exact keys and structure from Haloscan should be preserved‚Äîonly truncate lists to top 3 items.
- Properly encode all strings to prevent JSON errors.
- The Perplexity `perplexity_summary` field is free text and must be included as-is.
- The current date placeholder `{{$today}}` should be injected dynamically at runtime to guide recency.

---

**Start your work by:**

- Creating the Haloscan payload with the exact `title`.
- Performing the Haloscan HTTP request and retrieving results.
- Extracting and filtering top 3 items per relevant field.
- Building the Perplexity prompt as specified and querying the tool.
- Finally, outputting the combined JSON object containing both the Haloscan structured data and the Perplexity textual summary for the Orchestrator agent.

---

parameters.content:
# Workflow Overview: Automated Product Content Generation
# üöÄ Start Process
Form submission triggers workflow where user selects content type:

create_product_description
create_product_meta
create_product_seo

üìä Data Collection
Search Airtable for product records
Fetch product details from e-commerce platform using product handle
Get complete product information (ID, title, description, vendor, etc.)

üîÑ Title Optimization Branch
Combines product title with vendor name
Updates product title in e-commerce platform
Marks title update status as completed in Airtable

ü§ñ AI Orchestrator Processing
Central agent receives product data and content type rules, then:

For Product Descriptions:

Discovers premium keywords
Checks SEO compliance
Generates optimized product descriptions
Updates e-commerce platform with new content
Marks completion in Airtable
For Meta Fields:

Processes product metadata
Updates meta field information
Marks meta creation as complete
For SEO Fields:

Generates SEO-optimized content
Updates SEO fields in e-commerce platform
Marks SEO creation as complete
‚úÖ Completion
All specified content types are processed
Airtable records updated with completion status
Workflow ends successfully
üîß Tools Available
E-commerce platform product updates
Airtable record modifications
AI-powered content generation agents
Each process follows a sequential workflow ensuring quality content generation and proper tracking of completion status.

# üìù Product Description Agent ## üéØ Purpose: Generates SEO-optimized French Shopify product descriptions with verified facts and compliance üìä Workflow Overview üì• Input Product data: id, title, handle, instructions Title format: {Product Name}, {Strength/Weight} ‚Äì {Quantity} ‚Äì {Brand} Retrieves shortlisted_keywords from Airtable via handle ‚öôÔ∏è Process üîç Data Parsing & Research Extracts Product Name, Strength/Weight, Quantity, Brand from title Fetches shortlisted keywords via Airtable search Conducts Perplexity research for verified French facts only üìã Fact Verification Sources: official labels, product pages, technical sheets, regulatory docs Captures: composition, standardization, certifications, quality controls Zero invention policy - only documented facts included üèóÔ∏è Content Structure One

headline: Product Name + Brand (wrapped in ) First paragraph: Product Name wrapped in Body:

,

,

    ,
  • structure only Length: 150-300 words (hard cap) üéØ SEO Optimization 1.fr alignment: >90% semantic coverage for product intent TextFocus balance: Natural TF-IDF distribution Keyword integration: Primary keyword in first paragraph Anti-cannibalization: Unique vs competitors and internal catalog üì§ Output Clean HTML body_html for Shopify Product identifiers (id, handle) for Orchestrator SEO-optimized French content ready for SERP ranking üîß Technical Stack ü§ñ LLM: OpenRouter Claude Sonnet 4 üß© Memory: 15-message buffer window üîç Research: Perplexity for fact verification üìä Data: Airtable MCP integration üá´üá∑ Target: French e-commerce supplements ‚ú® Key Features üõ°Ô∏è Compliance Rules üìµ Forbidden terms: Revolutionary, Amazing, Miracle, Ultimate üö´ Exclusions: Usage instructions, posology, warnings, advice ‚úÖ Supplements focus: Technical features and benefits only üè∑Ô∏è Brand policy: Single mention in

    only üé® HTML Structure Rules üì∞ Headlines: Exactly one

    with Product Name + Brand üí™ Strong tags: Maximum 3 total (

    brand, first paragraph product name, optional tech highlight) üöØ No markdown: Pure HTML only for Shopify compatibility üìè Length control: 150-300 words enforced üî¨ Research Standards üìö Verified sources: Official documentation only üß™ Technical data: Standardization, concentrations, certifications üèÜ Quality controls: HPLC, GMP/ISO, batch testing üå± Certifications: Vegan, non-GMO (if verified) üéØ SEO Standards üîç Primary keyword: Product Name in first paragraph üìà Semantic coverage: 1.fr entity alignment ‚öñÔ∏è TF-IDF balance: TextFocus optimization üé™ Natural integration: No keyword stuffing üö® Quality Checklist ‚úÖ

    contains Product Name + -wrapped Brand ‚úÖ No Strength/Weight or Quantity in headline ‚úÖ Product Name in first paragraph with ‚úÖ 150-300 words with natural keyword integration ‚úÖ Maximum 3 tags total ‚úÖ All claims verifiable from official sources ‚úÖ Unique content preventing cannibalization

# üè∑Ô∏è Shopify Metafields Agent ## üéØ Purpose: Generates six professional French metafields for Super Supps Shopify products with strict compliance and formatting ## üìä Workflow Overview üì• Input Product data: id, title, body_html, product_type, handle Title parsing: NAME, WEIGHT, QUANTITY, BRAND (kept separate) Retrieves shortlisted_keywords from Airtable via handle ‚öôÔ∏è Process üîç Data Research & Validation Perplexity research for verified French facts only Sources: official labels, compositions, certifications, allergens Zero invention policy - "donn√©e non pr√©cis√©e" if unavailable Fetches shortlisted keywords via Airtable MCP üèóÔ∏è Metafield Generation Crea metafields with strict formatting: üì§ Output JSON structure with all 6 metafields Clean HTML using only allowed tags French regulatory compliance maintained üîß Technical Stack ü§ñ LLM: OpenRouter Claude Sonnet 4 üß© Memory: 10-message buffer window üîç Research: Perplexity for fact verification üìä Data: Airtable MCP integration üîß Tools: Workflow tool for meta operations üá´üá∑ Target: French supplement regulations ‚ú® Key Features üé® HTML Formatting Rules üìù Allowed tags only:

,

    ,
  • , , üö´ Forbidden: Headings, tables, links, nested

    in

  • üìè Block structure: Each element on own line for renderer compatibility üè∑Ô∏è Bold labels: Start lines with Label : pattern üí™ Bold Token Management üìä Enforced quotas: Each metafield has specific bold count limits üéØ NAME emphasis: Every NAME occurrence wrapped in üè¢ BRAND policy: Mentioned exactly once across ingredients OR description_courte üî¢ Key figures: Doses, percentages, standardizations in bold üõ°Ô∏è Compliance Standards üìö Verified facts only: Official labels and authoritative sources ‚öñÔ∏è French regulations: Supplement-specific compliance requirements üö® Mandatory warnings: Regulatory sentences with exact phrasing üîç Allergen highlighting: Individual allergen tokens in bold üß¨ Dynamic Category Support ü•õ Proteins: Filtration tech, enzyme complexes, lactose info üåø Botanicals: Standardizations, extraction ratios üíä Vitamins/Minerals: Chemical forms, units, %VNR ‚ö° Pre-workouts: Active doses, caffeine warnings üîç Quality Validation ‚úÖ Every NAME occurrence wrapped in ‚úÖ Bold quotas enforced per metafield ‚úÖ Labels appear as bold prefixes with colons ‚úÖ Individual allergen tokens in bold ‚úÖ No disallowed tags or nested structures ‚úÖ French punctuation and units preserved ‚úÖ Regulatory compliance maintained

# Seo fields


# üéØ SEO Meta Description Agent
üéØ Purpose: Creates optimized French meta descriptions for Shopify products targeting Google search results and French consumers

üìä Workflow Overview
üì• Input
Product data: id, title, body_html, product_type, handle
Uses product handle to retrieve keyword data from Airtable
‚öôÔ∏è Process
üîç Research Phase
Single comprehensive Perplexity search for French SEO best practices
Focuses on current year trends, CTR optimization, anti-keyword stuffing
Covers organic reach improvement and French market preferences
üìä Data Collection
Searches Airtable using product handle as filter
Retrieves shortlisted keywords and additional product information
Gathers all necessary data in single operation
‚úçÔ∏è Description Creation
Combines all collected data sources for optimization
Applies French SEO best practices from research
Integrates keywords naturally without stuffing
Creates compelling, click-worthy descriptions
üîß Final Processing
Sends created description to processing tool
Applies final optimizations and validation
Ensures compliance with technical requirements
üì§ Output

{
  "id": "product_id",
  "description": "Optimized French meta description"
}
üîß Technical Stack
ü§ñ LLM: OpenRouter Claude Sonnet 4
üß© Memory: 10-message buffer window
üîç Research: Perplexity for SEO intelligence
üìä Data: Airtable MCP integration
üîß Tools: Meta description workflow processor
üá´üá∑ Target: French Google search results
‚ú® Key Features
üìù Content Requirements
üá´üá∑ French language: Correct, natural French expressions
üìè Character limit: Maximum 155 characters including spaces
üö´ Clean text: No HTML, markdown, or special formatting
üéØ Professional tone: Accessible for French consumers
üîç SEO Optimization
üîë Keyword integration: Natural placement of 1-2 shortlisted terms
üìà CTR focus: Click-worthy content without overselling
üé™ Anti-stuffing: Semantic variations and natural flow
üèÜ USP highlighting: Unique selling proposition emphasis
üß† Strategic Approach
üí° Benefit-led: Starts with most compelling product benefit
üéØ French market: Tailored to local consumer preferences
üìä Data-driven: Uses research insights and keyword data
‚úÖ Factual accuracy: Based only on provided product information
üîÑ Linear Workflow
üîç Research: Single Perplexity call for SEO best practices
üìä Data collection: Airtable search by handle for keywords
‚úçÔ∏è Creation: Optimized description using all data
üîß Processing: Final tool validation and optimization
üì§ Output: JSON response with ID and description
üé≠ Quality Standards
‚úÖ Perfect French language and grammar
‚úÖ 155 character limit strictly enforced
‚úÖ Keywords naturally integrated from Airtable
‚úÖ Compelling and click-worthy content
‚úÖ Professional but accessible tone
‚úÖ Factual accuracy maintained
‚úÖ Anti-keyword stuffing compliance

# üîç SEO Compliance Checker Agent
## üéØ Purpose: Prevents keyword cannibalization and generates SEO strategies for French Shopify products

## üìä Workflow Overview
üì• Input
Premium Keyword Discovery JSON containing:
haloscan_keyword_overview (metrics, matches, highlights)
perplexity_summary (market intelligence)
Product handle for matching
‚öôÔ∏è Process
üîç Keyword Extraction
Extracts primary keyword from keyword_match array
Combines all keywords from keyword_match and similar_highlight
Deduplicates keyword list for analysis
üåê SERP Overlap Analysis
Calls Haloscan /api/keywords/serp-compare for each keyword individually
Analyzes 5-month historical ranking data
Identifies existing domain rankings on

üö´ Cannibalization Prevention

Filters out keywords already ranking for other products
Excludes current product/variant rankings
Selects optimal keyword with lowest overlap + highest search volume
üìã Data Management
Updates Airtable shortlisted_keywords field
Matches records by product Handle
Maintains filtered keyword database
üß† Strategy Generation
Combines filtered keywords with original Perplexity summary
Incorporates latest French SEO trends and buyer intent
Generates actionable SEO content strategy via Perplexity

üì§ Output

SEO content strategy text optimized for French market
Filtered keyword list stored in Airtable
Cannibalization-free keyword recommendations
üîß Technical Stack
ü§ñ LLM: OpenRouter Claude 3.5 Sonnet
üß© Memory: 10-message buffer window
üîå API: Haloscan SERP compare endpoint
üìä Database: Airtable integration
üîÆ Intelligence: Perplexity for strategy generation
üá´üá∑ Target: French e-commerce SEO
‚ú® Key Features
üõ°Ô∏è Cannibalization prevention through SERP overlap analysis
üìà Data-driven keyword selection (volume vs. competition)
üéØ Domain-specific filtering for super-bw-supps.fr
üíæ Automated database updates in Airtable
üìù AI-powered content strategies via Perplexity
üîÑ Historical ranking analysis (5-month period)
üé≠ Input Detection Logic
JSON Detection: Identifies Premium Keyword Discovery format
Field Validation: Checks for required haloscan_keyword_overview and perplexity_summary
Auto-routing: Processes based on detected input structure
üöÄ Essential for maintaining SEO health while scaling French Shopify content without keyword conflicts.

# üîç Premium Keyword Discovery Agent
## üéØ Purpose: Automated SEO keyword research for Shopify products targeting French market

## üìä Workflow Overview
### üì• Input
Shopify product data (ID, title, description, vendor, etc.)
Uses product title as primary keyword
‚öôÔ∏è Process
üåê Haloscan API Call
Sends product title to haloscan.com keyword overview endpoint
Requests: metrics, keyword matches, similar highlights, top sites, SERP data
üìà Data Extraction
Extracts top 3 entries from each Haloscan response field
Preserves raw structure while filtering for relevance
üß† Market Intelligence
Generates Perplexity prompt with extracted keywords
Analyzes search intent, trending questions, buyer behaviors
Focuses on Google France with current date context
üì§ Output

{
  "product_id": "...",
  "haloscan_keyword_overview": {
    "metrics": [...],
    "keyword_match": [...], 
    "similar_highlight": [...],
    "top_sites": [...],
    "serp": [...]
  },
  "perplexity_summary": "..."
}
üîß Technical Stack
ü§ñ LLM: OpenRouter GPT-4o
üß© Memory: 10-message buffer window
üîå API: Haloscan keyword research
üìã Output: Structured JSON parser
üá´üá∑ Target: French e-commerce SEO
‚ú® Key Features
üí∞ Revenue-driven keyword selection
üèÜ Competition analysis via SERP data
üìà Real-time trends through Perplexity integration
üîÑ Structured output for automation pipelines
üöÄ Perfect for scaling  Shopify SEO content creation with data-driven keyword intelligence.

options.systemMessage:
=You are the Super Supps Metafields Splitter. You receive a single JSON object (possibly embedded in free text) containing: {id, "3_argument_client", "ingredients", "recommandations", "valeurs_nutritionnelles", "avertissement", "description_courte"}. ## CRITICAL HTML STRUCTURE RULES **PARAGRAPH HANDLING:** - Use ONLY complete, well-formed paragraph tags: `

content

` - NEVER split paragraphs or create `

` sequences - For line breaks within content, use complete separate paragraphs - Each paragraph must be fully self-contained **CLEAN HTML GENERATION:** - Generate clean, well-structured HTML only - No malformed tags, no unclosed tags, no orphaned closing tags - Every opening tag must have its corresponding closing tag - Maintain proper nesting: lists inside paragraphs are allowed ## Goal Emit six separate JSON objects, one per metafield, in NDJSON style: each object on its own line, no enclosing array, no wrapper object, no comments. Each field's value is clean, well-formed HTML embedded inside a JSON string. ## Input handling Robustly extract the first well-formed JSON object from the text. Read fields: id, 3_argument_client, ingredients, recommandations, valeurs_nutritionnelles, avertissement, description_courte. If a field is missing or null, output it as an empty string "" (still produce the object for that field). ## HTML policy **Allowed tags inside field values:** `

`, `

    `, `
  • `, ``, ``, `

    `, `

    `, `

    `, `

    `, `

    `, `
    ` **HTML Structure Requirements:** - Each paragraph: `

    Complete sentence or content here.

    ` - Lists: `
    • Item 1
    • Item 2
    ` - Headings: `

    Section Title

    ` - Bold text: `important text` or `important text` - NO orphaned closing tags like `

    ` without opening `

    ` - NO incomplete paragraph structures - NO raw line breaks - use complete paragraphs instead **Content Formatting Rules:** - For multi-paragraph content, create separate complete `

    ` tags - For lists, ensure each `

  • ` is properly nested within `
      ` - For emphasis, wrap important text in `` tags - Escape any inner double quotes as `\"` ## Ordering Emit objects in this exact order: 1. 3_argument_client 2. ingredients 3. recommandations 4. valeurs_nutritionnelles 5. avertissement 6. description_courte ## Output format (NDJSON; six lines, no array, no extra text) {"id":"","3_argument_client":"

      Clean HTML content here.

      "} {"id":"","ingredients":"
      • Ingredient 1
      • Ingredient 2
      "} {"id":"","recommandations":"

      Recommendation content.

      "} {"id":"","valeurs_nutritionnelles":"

      Nutritional values content.

      "} {"id":"","avertissement":"

      Warning content.

      "} {"id":"","description_courte":"

      Short description content.

      "} ## QUALITY ASSURANCE CHECKS Before outputting each JSON line, verify: ‚úì No `

      ` sequences anywhere in the HTML ‚úì Every `

      ` has a matching `

      ` ‚úì Every `
        ` has a matching `
      ` ‚úì Every `
    • ` has a matching `
      • ` ‚úì All HTML is properly nested and structured ‚úì JSON is valid with properly escaped quotes ‚úì Content flows naturally without HTML artifacts ## Strict JSON rules - Keys and strings must be double-quoted - No trailing commas - Repeat the exact same id value in all six objects - Output only the six JSON lines; do not prepend or append any prose, code fences, or Markdown - Ensure HTML content is properly escaped within JSON strings **REMEMBER:** The goal is to generate clean HTML that will be converted to Shopify rich text format. Any malformed HTML or `

      ` artifacts will appear as visible text in the final Shopify store, which is unacceptable.

parameters.content:
# Metafield Processor & Uploader ## üéØ Purpose: Converts generated HTML metafields to Shopify Rich Text format and uploads them to product records ## üìä Workflow Overview üì• Input Triggered by another workflow containing metafield data Single JSON object with product ID and HTML content for multiple fields ‚öôÔ∏è Process üîç HTML Parsing & Splitting Extracts JSON metafield data from input Uses GPT-4o to parse and split content into individual components Validates HTML structure and fixes malformed tags Ensures clean, well-structured HTML output üîß Rich Text Conversion 6 parallel processing streams for different content types Each stream converts HTML to Shopify Rich Text format via JavaScript Handles paragraph structures, lists, headings, and inline formatting Aggressive preprocessing to eliminate HTML artifacts üöÄ Shopify Integration 6 parallel GraphQL mutations to Shopify Admin API Updates product metafields with converted rich text content Uses proper Shopify metafield structure with namespaces and keys Maintains data integrity during upload process üì§ Output Successfully updated Shopify product metafields Rich text format compatible with Shopify themes Error handling for failed uploads üîß Technical Stack ü§ñ LLM: OpenRouter GPT-4o for parsing üß© Memory: 10-message buffer window üìä Parser: Structured output validation ‚öôÔ∏è Conversion: Custom JavaScript HTML-to-RichText processor üõí API: Shopify GraphQL Admin API üîó Integration: Shopify Access Token authentication ‚ú® Key Features üõ†Ô∏è HTML Processing üìù Clean parsing: Removes malformed tags and artifacts üîß Structure validation: Ensures proper HTML hierarchy üö´ Artifact removal: Eliminates

sequences and orphaned tags üìã Format preservation: Maintains lists, headings, and emphasis üé® Rich Text Conversion üìÑ Paragraph handling: Converts HTML paragraphs to Shopify blocks üìã List processing: Maintains ordered/unordered list structures üí™ Bold/italic support: Preserves text formatting üîó Link handling: Converts HTML links to Shopify link objects üîí Quality Assurance ‚úÖ Structure validation: Every opening tag has matching closing tag üßπ Clean output: No raw HTML artifacts in final content üîÑ Error handling: Fallback content for processing failures üìä Debug information: Detailed structure analysis for troubleshooting üöÄ Shopify Integration ‚ö° Parallel uploads: 6 simultaneous metafield updates üéØ GraphQL mutations: Efficient API communication üîê Secure authentication: Token-based access control üìç Proper targeting: Product-specific metafield assignment üé≠ Processing Flow üì• Input Reception: Receives metafield data from trigger üîç Content Parsing: Splits into individual field components üîß Format Conversion: Parallel HTML-to-RichText processing üöÄ API Upload: Simultaneous Shopify metafield updates ‚úÖ Validation: Confirms successful uploads üöÄ Essential for converting AI-generated HTML content into Shopify-compatible rich text metafields, ensuring proper formatting and theme compatibility.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a strict output parser.
You ONLY process the input JSON string received from the SEO bot, and output a structured JSON object with two fields:

id: the Shopify Product ID as an integer (if it is provided as a string that is an integer, convert it to integer value; if not present or invalid, set to null)

description: the meta description as a string. If missing or not a string, set to "" (empty string).

Instructions:

Extract and parse the first well-formed JSON object from the incoming string (the SEO bot output).

Validate and normalize the output with the following exact structure:

json
{
  "id": <integer or null>,
  "description": "<string>"
}
If the id is present as a number or numeric string, output it as an integer. Otherwise, set "id": null.

If the description value is present and a string, return it as is (trimmed of leading/trailing whitespace). If it is missing or not a string, output "" (empty string).

Do not output any other fields, objects, comments, or metadata. Output only the required keys.

Return only the valid, final structured JSON object‚Äîno markdown, no code fences, no extra text.

Example:

Input:

json
"{ \"id\": \"12345678\", \"description\": \"High-purity whey for fast muscle recovery and growth. Delicious Chocolate flavor.\" }"
Output:

json
{
  "id": 12345678,
  "description": "High-purity whey for fast muscle recovery and growth. Delicious Chocolate flavor."
}
If a field is missing or invalid, output default values as above.

user.name: Kumar Shivam
user.bio:
I'm an automation specialist who helps startups, agencies, and growth teams save time and scale faster using n8n.

I design smart, reliable workflows that connect tools like HubSpot, Slack, OpenAI, Claude, Pipedrive, Google Ads, and vector databases (Qdrant, Pinecone). Whether it's auto-assigning leads, generating AI-powered reports, triggering Slack alerts, or syncing APIs ‚Äî I build automations that just work.
Let‚Äôs turn your manual processes into automated systems that scale.
